results.title: The Killing of Sister George [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George” the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman, decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: The Deluge = Potop. Parts 1 and 2 [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Hoffman, Wilhelm Hollender and Film Polski
results.brief_description: This is a film of epic proportions somewhat reminiscent to “Doctor Zhivago” in its grandness, its breathtaking scenery, superb cinematography (Jerzy Wojcik), evocative images and a fine cast of actors. Based on the Nobel prize-winning novel by author Henryk Sienkiewicz, “The Deluge” takes place in 17th century Poland, during the Polish-Swedish War (1655-1660) with the central plot revolving around the intense and often stormy love affair between the main character, Andrzej Kmicic (Daniel Olbrychski), a noble man and a soldier often erratic in temperament, and Olenka (Malgorzata Braunek) a young gentlewoman of strong beliefs and convictions who will over the course of their relationship, be forced to question the morality of the war and Andrzej’s involvement in it. Shot on location in Poland in many of the ancient and historic castles and accompanied by an original muscial score (by Kazimierz Serocki) which enhances and adds depth to the story, this is a war film with a difference. The myriad of characters representing all walks of life, from the peasants to the aristocracy, through to the soldiers in battle, weave in and out of the story adding a sense of realism and involvement for the onlooker. “Potop” was nominated for Best Foreign Film in the 1974 Academy Awards. Cast also includes Tadeusz Lomnicki, Kazimierz Wichniarz, Wladyslaw Hancza, Leszek Teleszynski. WARNING: The English subtitles are often out of sync, and sometimes too fast to read.

results.title: Solomon and Gaenor
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrison, Sheryl Crown, APT Film and Television and Sianel 4 Cymru (S4C) (Channel 4 Wales)
results.brief_description: Set against the Tredegar riots against Jewish shops in 1911, “Solomon and Gaenor” is a tragic love story of Jewish cloth merchant, Solomon (Ioan Gruffudd), and Gaenor (Nia Roberts), daughter of a struggling Welsh mining family. Solomon keeps his Jewish heritage a secret from his new love, who becomes frustrated by his inability to settle down and marry, and for the unspoken secrets between them. They are forced to re-evaluate their relationship when Gaenor falls pregnant and tensions mount between striking Welsh miners and Jewish storeholders, placing Solomon’s family in the front line. Director Paul Morrison asserts that the film is principally about the universal notion that we hide aspects of ourselves from those we love. He also manages to capture a painful chapter in the British Jewish experience. Cast also includes Sue Jones Davies, William Thomas and Mark Jones. In Welsh, Hebrew and English with English subtitles.

results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Ben Bolt, Martin Pope and Meridian Broadcasting
results.brief_description: This moody, atmospheric rendition of the Henry James novel stars Jodhi May as the governess entrusted with the care of two seemingly adorable children whom she suspects may be under the influence of supernatural powers. Rumours abound regarding the previous governess - Miss Jessel, who killed herself when she became pregnant to her master’s valet, Peter Quint, also now dead. Both Jessel and Quint begin appearing to the governess, who learns the children can see them too, particularly the boy. Unable to contact the orphaned children’s guardian (Colin Firth) due to a clause in her contract which prohibits any contact, the young governess must face the unknown alone if she is to save the soul of the children. Cast also includes Pam Ferris, Joe Sowerbutts and Grace Robinson.

results.title: The Swarm
results.creator_credit: Irwin Allen and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: From celebrated epic disaster movie director Irwin Allen, this tale of destruction wrought by swarms of millions of killer African and South American bees stands alongside “The Poseidon adventure” and “Towering Inferno” in Allen’s production record, though with a somewhat lesser impact. Entomologist Brad Crane (Michael Caine) discovers that deadly South American bees have been breeding with their harmless relations in the North. Worse still, something is making them come together in huge killer swarms and the terror of their destruction threatens to spread throughout North America. As the bees close in on Houston, Crane joins forces with General Slater (Richard Widmark) to try and stop the devastation. Filmed with an estimated 22 million bees, this doomsday epic also boasts a collection of stars including Katherine Ross, Olivia de Havilland, Henry Fonda, Fred MacMurray, Richard Chamberlain, Jose Ferrer, Patty Duke Astin, Lee Grant and Bradford Dillman.

results.title: The English patient [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Anthony Minghella, Saul Zaentz and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Based on Michael Ondaatje’s Booker prize-winning novel, “The English Patient” is a sumptuous romance set during the second world war in the deserts of North Africa and the rolling hills of Tuscany. Hana (Juliette Binoche), a shell-shocked Canadian nurse decides to stay in an abandoned villa to nurse a mysterious English patient (Ralph Fiennes) who is burned beyond recognition and doesn’t remember his name. Gradually we learn the truth of his identity and of his doomed love affair with Katherine Mansfield (Kristen Scott Thomas). (Awards: Winner of 9 Oscars at the 1996 Academy Awards, including Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress - Juliette Binoche and Best Cinematography for Australian John Seale)

results.title: The Jigsaw Man
results.creator_credit: Terence Young, Benjamin Fisz and J&M Entertainment
results.brief_description: Spy thriller inspired by the true story of British intelligence officer and Soviet spy Kim Philby (1912-1988). Having defected to Russia in 1979, Sir Philip Kimberly (Michael Caine), Cambridge graduate and former Director-General of M.I.6 is called upon by the Russians to carry out one last mission. With a different identity and a face altered beyond recognition by plastic surgery, he is sent back to England in the guise of a Soviet citizen to retrieve a secret dossier of names he supposedly hid there several years ago. When he decides to defect a second time the viewer is drawn into a complex web of espionage, counter-espionage and counter-counter-espionage where nothing is as it at first appears. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Susan George and Robert Powell.

results.title: Too late the hero [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Robert Aldrich’s “Too late the hero” is a fine wartime drama set in WW II starring Cliff Robertson as Lt. Lawson, a US Navy interpreter who is ordered - against his own wishes - to join a British Commando unit in the South Pacific tasked with destroying a Japanese communications centre. Led by the incompetent Captain Hornsby (Denholm Elliott), the unit includes burnt-out soldiers - personified by the embittered, cynical Tosh Hearne (Michael Caine) - who want no part of the false glory inherent in this suicide mission for which they have been ‘volunteered’. The mission goes badly, with almost all of the men dying and the Japanese commander, Major Yamaguchi (Ken Takakura), taunting the survivors to give themselves up, working a psychological battle of wills against the allies as they turn on each other. Made in 1970 at a time when America was embroiled in Vietnam, “Too late the hero” is an intelligent, provocative and dramatic exploration of the nature of war and the role of the hero. Its portrayal of bloody and random killing and the manner in which men are reduced to their primal survival instincts during war is a milestone in the development of the war film. In addition, its avoidance of a standard caricatured portrayal of the Japanese is noteworthy. Filmed on location in the Philippines, “Too late the hero” is visually stunning, and boasts one of Michael Caine’s finest performances. Cast also includes Henry Fonda.

results.title: Without a clue
results.creator_credit: Thom Eberhardt, Mark Stirdivant and ITC Group
results.brief_description: What if the most famous detective of all time - Sherlock Holmes (Michael Caine) - was a drunk, gambling, womanizing, one time actor, created in the mind of his previously overshadowed but vastly superior assistant, Doctor Watson (Ben Kingsley)? Such is the premise of “Without a clue”. Fed up with Holmes’ bad form, Watson attempts to branch out on his own as the ‘Crime Doctor’, only to be told that it’s Holmes the people want. Thus, Holmes and Watson are forced to join sides again on a case involving counterfeit 5 pound notes. All is progressing well until the appearance of Holmes/Watson’s nemesis, Professor Moriaty, then Watson disappears into the canal - presumed dead, and it’s up to the oft inebriated Holmes to solve his first case, unassisted, and prove his crime solving capacity to the dubious Inspector Lestrade. Cast also includes Lysette Anthony, Jeffrey Jones and Paul Freeman.

results.title: Shirley Valentine
results.brief_description: Pauline Collins is Shirley Valentine-Bradshaw, a housewife and mother in cold dull England who dreams of adventure and stimulation. Her best friend wins a holiday in Greece and Shirley decides to come along. On the beautiful island of Mykonos, Shirley finds herself increasingly attracted to fisherman Costas (Tom Conti), and before the whirl wind two weeks on the Aegean is finished, she has to make big decisions about whether to return to her middle-class life back in England or to pursue the adventures of a new life promised by Greece and Costa. With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.

With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.
description_for_label: Pauline Collins is Shirley Valentine-Bradshaw, a housewife and mother in cold dull England who dreams of adventure and stimulation. Her best friend wins a holiday in Greece and Shirley decides to come along. On the beautiful island of Mykonos, Shirley finds herself increasingly attracted to fisherman Costas (Tom Conti), and before the whirl wind two weeks on the Aegean is finished, she has to make big decisions about whether to return to her middle-class life back in England or to pursue the adventures of a new life promised by Greece and Costa. With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.
